alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CURRITUCK COUNTY THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Corolla, or 8 miles north of Grandy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Corolla around 435 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Barco, Waterlily, Coinjock, and Aydlett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina.
